raw_text:
Pop band Busted to 'take a break'
 
 Chart-topping pop band Busted have confirmed that they plan to "take a break", following rumours that they were on the verge of splitting.
 
 A statement from the band's record company Universal said frontman Charlie Simpson planned to spend some time working with his other band, Fightstar. However they said that Busted would "reconvene in due course". The band have had eight top three hits, including four number ones, since they first hit the charts in 2002. Their singles include What I Go To School For, Year 3000, Crashed The Wedding, You Said No, and Who's David?
 
 The band, which also includes members Matt Jay and James Bourne, made the top ten with their self-titled debut album, as well as the follow-up, A Present For Everyone, in 2003. They won best pop act and best breakthrough act at the 2004 Brit Awards and were nominated for best British group. Most recently they topped the charts with the theme from the live-action film version of Thunderbirds, which was voted Record Of The Year on the ITV1 show. The band have capitalised on a craze for artists playing catchy pop music with rock overtones. The trio are seen as an alternative to more manufactured artists who are not considered credible musicians because they do not write their own songs or play their own instruments. However, recent rumours have suggested that Simpson has been wanting to quit the band to focus on Fightstar. He now plans to take Fightstar on tour.
llama3.2:1b: Busted plan to "take a break" after rumors of split; frontman Charlie Simpson working with other band Fightstar; Busted will reconvene in due course; the band has had eight top hits, including four number ones since 2002.
llama3.2:3b: Busted pop band to "take a break", with Charlie Simpson planning to work with fightstar and potentially join them on tour after previously being involved in a potential split.
gemma2:2b: Busted will take a break after rumors of a split became true.
Charlie Simpson will spend time with his other band, Fightstar.
The band will reconvene in the future and have enjoyed considerable success, including multiple top-ten hits and Brit Awards nominations.
qwen2.5:0.5b: A pop band known for their hit singles including "What I Go To School For", "Year 3000", "Crashed The Wedding", and others, announced they were taking a break from performing live performances in order to recharge.
They had six top-three hits since the release of their debut album "The Year 2000" in 2002.
A self-titled album and follow-up "A Present For Everyone" reached #1 on the US charts in 2003.
The band won multiple awards for their performance, including Best Pop Act and Best Breakthrough Act at the 2004 Brit Awards.
In addition to their chart-topping singles, they were nominated for Best British Group.

The band has sold an estimated five million copies of "Thunderbirds" and gained popularity through viral music videos such as "I'm Not A F**k", which was voted Record Of The Year on ITV1's show Thunderbirds.
Recent rumors suggest that frontman Charlie Simpson is looking to leave the band to focus on his solo projects, Fightstar.
He has stated that he now plans to take Fightstar on tour.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Pop band Busted will take a break after rumors of them splitting were confirmed; they have eight top-three hits and made the UK charts with their self-titled debut album in 2003, but recent rumours suggest frontman Charlie Simpson is planning to quit for more time with his band Fightstar.
qwen2.5:3b: Pop band Busted is taking a break following rumors of a split.
Frontman Charlie Simpson will work with his other band Fightstar and the band plans to reconvene in the future.
Since 2002, they've had eight top three hits including What I Go To School For, Year 3000, Crashed The Wedding, You Said No, and Who's David?.
They won Brit Awards for best pop act and best breakthrough act in 2004 with albums like Busted and A Present For Everyone.
Recently they topped the charts with Thunderbirds theme song.
Known for combining catchy pop music with rock, Simpson now plans to focus on Fightstar’s tour instead of quitting Busted.

The band had eight top three hits in the chart since it first hit the charts in 2002.
They included songs like What I Go To School For, Year 3k000, Crashed The Wedding, You Said No, and Who's David?
Most recently, they released a self-titled album as well as follow-up A Present For Everyone in 2003.
They won Best Pop Act and best breakthrough act at the 2004 Brit Awards and were nominated for this event.
Their live-action film version of Thunderbirds has been voted Record Of The Year on the ITV1 show.
smollm:1.7b: Busted is a pop rock band from the UK formed in 2002 by Charlie Simpson, Matt Jay and James Bourne.
They have had eight number one hits since their debut album in 2003, including "What I Go To School For" (2004), "Year 3000" (2005) and "Crashed The Wedding" (2006).
Their singles include "You Said No" (2003), "Who's David?"
(2003), "A Present For Everyone" (2004), "What I Go To School For" (2005) and "Thunderbirds" (2007).
They have won several awards, including the 2004 Brit Awards for Best Pop Act and Best British Group.
The band has been nominated for several awards, including the 2009 Brit Awards for Best Rock Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocals and Best Rock Instrumental Solo.
They have also won several awards at the 2013 Brit Awards for Best Pop Song and Best Rock Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocals.

Busted has capitalized on a craze for artists playing catchy pop music with rock overtones, which is seen as an alternative to more manufactured artists who are not considered credible musicians because they do not write their own songs or play their own instruments.

However, recent rumors have suggested that Simpson has been wanting to quit the band to focus on Fightstar, and this may be a reason why he was nominated for Best Rock Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocals at the 2013 Brit Awards.
deepseek-r1:1.5b: Busted announces a break following rumors that frontman Charlie Simpson plans to collaborate with Fightstar but will reconvene soon.
Busted has eight top hits since 2002 and four number ones.
Their self-titled album was on the top ten in 2003, winning best pop act and Best Breakthrough Act award.
They topped the charts with a Thunderbirds movie theme, won Record Of The Year on ITV1.
Busted is seen as an alternative to established bands that aren't credible.
Simpson plans to focus on Fightstar and take it on tour now after breaking from Busted.
tinyllama:1.1b: Burst pop group Busted plan to take a break after announcing that Charlie Simpson will spend some time working with his other band, Fightstar, following rumors of Busted's split.
Busted have had eight top three hits since debuting in 2002 and have also seen success with their self-titled debut album, as well as the follow-up album, "A Present for Everyone," released in 2003.

In 2014, they were nominated for best pop act and best breakthrough act at the 2004 Brit Awards and received a record of the year nomination for their theme from the live-action film version of Thunderbirds, which was voted Record Of The Year on the ITV1 show.
In recent rumors, it has been suggested that Simpson wants to focus on Fightstar after announcing his intention to take the group on tour.

However, the band still has eight top-three hits, including four number ones, since they first hit the charts in 2002.
The band's album 'Busted,' released in 2003, is considered one of their best work.
The band has been nominated for several awards, and 'Crashed the Wedding' single was ranked as number six on Rolling Stone's list of the top ten pop songs of all time.

granite3.1-dense:2b: British pop band Busted, comprising Charlie Simpson, Matt Jay, and James Bourne, has announced a temporary hiatus.
Frontman Simpson intends to dedicate more time to his other band, Fightstar, while the group will reunite later.
The band, known for hits like "What I Go To School For" and "You Said No," achieved success with their 2002 self-titled debut and 2003's "A Present For Everyone."
